text: <@U2P0N5J5A|sergefdrv> has joined the channel
FYI, here is another COP squad update ... the last for 2016

Complete:
1.	cop server init
2.	cop server start
3.	cop client register
4.	cop client enroll
5.	cop client reenroll (for renewing ECert)
6.	cop client revoke – single cert or all for user
7.	LDAP support for user registry (FAB-1144)
8.	COP server cluster support
9.	DB support (sqllite, mysql, postgres)

In Review:
1.	TCerts
2.	Enforcing validity period for ECerts & TCerts
3.	Storing ECerts in PEM files for fabric integration with MSP
4.	Docker compose for COP cluster

In Progress:
1.	BCCSP integration for HSM support
2.	Support for initializing an intermediate COP server (FAB 1465)
3.	CLI improvement (FAB 1170)

Next
1.	Swagger API doc (FAB-763) and doc improvement (FAB-1464)
2.	Code simplification
3.	Audit (FAB-1228)
Where is the latest version of the fabric-cop design document please?
It is/was in one of the JIRA items, I recall. Can someone please point it out?
we need to hold off on any new functionality and go back and harden / refactor what's there at this point.
Yup. I suggest, too, to call a “freeze” pretty soon.
part of that would, however, include the API / Swagger  :wink:
why the latest makefile require to have docker in path? it seems not necessary if just need to run `make cop`, but it always check before any task...
<@U31M2620Z> I agree.  Can you open a jira bug for this?
<@U11MANG9G> See <https://docs.google.com/document/d/1TRYHcaT8yMn8MZlDtreqzkDcXx0WI50AV2JpAcvAM5w>
<@U0PB67X4K> Wasn't planning on doing audit for V1 ... and everything else pertains to hardening/cleaning up I think
Do you disagree?
I actually want to hold off on BCCSP and intermediate CAs as well
agree on audit
ok ... intermediate CA is pretty trivial, but can hold off
cool, created <https://jira.hyperledger.org/browse/FAB-1467>
<@U3JGTMWB0|shakespeare> has joined the channel
Hello, everyone, I have a question about deployment of fabrtic-cop.
How to deploy more than one fabric-cop instance which can form a cop network?
According to cop design document, there could be multi-cop instances in a fabric blockchain. We can do that by commands "cop client submitJoinRequest"
However, seemingly, these commands have not yet been implemented.
